author: hroskes
body:
Is there any reason not to implement <, <=, >, >= for int32 and similar?

I was very confused when I tried to do something like this:

```
myanalyzer = cms.EDAnalyzer("MyAnalyzer",
    myanalyzer.informationlevel = cms.int32(0),
)

#...

myanalyzer.informationlevel = max(myanalyzer.informationlevel, 3)

print myanalyzer.informationlevel  #prints cms.int32(0)
```

Because `__gt__` is not implemented, `max(cms.int32(0), 3)` returns `cms.int32(0)` because the class name comes later in the alphabet.

I don't see any way this could break anything, but please let me know if there's a particular reason it was left unimplemented.
title: inequality operators for cms types
